p: The hemolytic activity provides primary information on the cytotoxicity of the bioactive molecules on the healthy cells. Assessment of in vitro hemolytic activity by UV spectrophotometric method is an easy and effective technique to assess the cytotoxicity of the bioactive molecules [ 50]. Erythrocytes have been widely used for the assessment of hemolytic activity and it has been considered to be the major target, which is affected by the concentration of the bioactive molecules in the extract [ 61]. The advantages of using erythrocyte as a model for hemolytic activity are the easy availability and isolation of cells from the blood. Moreover, this property is similar to other cell membranes [ 50].
